profile.name: Haz
profile.bio: Author of @ariakit. Working with JavaScript, CSS, accessibility.

analysis.career_trajectory: Started with JavaScript in 2022, exploring various libraries and frameworks such as Ariakit, React, and Quill. In 2023, began working on REST API generator and MongoDB-related projects. Continued to contribute to open-source projects like Ariakit and React headless components. By 2025, started focusing on more advanced topics like React Context + State and Raycast extensions.

technical_obsessions.evidence: No specific evidence found in the provided comment history.
Contributed to TypeScript-based projects like ariakit-changesets-test and constate.

comment_analytics.communication_style: Asks deep architectural questions, provides detailed explanations of their thought process, and actively seeks feedback from others.

match_profile.similar_user_traits: Similar to a developer who is passionate about building complex web applications and contributing to open-source projects.
conversation_starters: What's your approach to handling errors in REST API generation?
How do you stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Ariakit?
Can you share an example of a challenging bug you've solved in one of your recent projects?
